str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or sugchuno from sun and cheo or its alternate; to commingle promiscuously, i.e. to throw into disorder, to perplex.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Language, speech, conversation, manner of speaking. From dialegomai; a discourse, i.e. 'dialect'.
